Detailed Description

Handles HTTP reuqest asynchronously with cookies.

HTTPClient encapsulate a of objects required to execute HTTP requests while handling cookies, authentication, connection management, and other features.

Signal handler for SIGPIPE is necessary when using HttpClient. Signal handler function (sigpipeHandler) will be invoked by following code: signal(SIGPIPE,sigpipeHandler); OR just ignore SIGPIPE signal by using signal(SIGPIPE,SIG_IGN)

 HttpClient hc;
 hc.addHttpClientListener(&listener);
 hc.execute(request);
 // Continue out work until listener is called.

Definition at line 50 of file HttpClient.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

gaia::net::HttpClient::HttpClient ( )
gaia::net::HttpClient::HttpClient ( HttpContext *  context,
IHttpClientListener *  listener 
)

Initialize an HttpClient with an HttpContext and listener, so the next line can be execute. 

 HttpClient client(pContext, pListener);
 client.execute(HttpRequest("http://www.example.com");
Parameters:
contextAn HttpContext that initializes the HttpClient. The context will not be deleted by HttpClient.
listenerPointer of listener, listener won't be deleted by HttpClient.
virtual gaia::net::HttpClient::~HttpClient ( ) [virtual]
gaia::net::HttpClient::HttpClient ( const HttpClient &  that) [private]

Member Function Documentation

void gaia::net::HttpClient::cancel ( )

Cancel current operation.

If client is waiting reading result, onError() of listener will be called with an error code NET_CANCELED and then it is safe to delete data buffer.

void gaia::net::HttpClient::cancelAuth ( )

Cancel the authentication require and get the error page.

const gaia::base::String &  password

Parameters:

passwordPassword of the user.
RESULT gaia::net::HttpClient::execute ( const HttpRequest &  request)

Execute a request.

Result of the request will be passed to user by listener.

Parameters:
requestRequest of the HTTP operation.
Returns:
An error code.
HttpContext* gaia::net::HttpClient::getContext ( ) const [inline]

Get context.

Returns:
Context that is currently being used in HttpClient object. NULL if HttpClient is using default context.

void gaia::net::HttpClient::readResponse ( gaia::base::ByteArray *  data)

Read response from remote host.

Data that is read will be passed through callback function when it completed. Reading buffer should be available until reading process is done.

Parameters:
dataData buffer for returning data.
void gaia::net::HttpClient::setAllowCertificateErrors ( bool  val)

setup Connect Timeout value

Returns:
Error code NET_ERROR_CONNECTION_TIMED_OUT connecting timeout comes up.
void gaia::net::HttpClient::setContext ( HttpContext *  context) [inline]

Set the context.

Context that is set to HttpClient may be modified, but it may not be deleted by HttpClient because it may be shared by multiple instances of HttpClient. Caller is responsible for deleting the context object.

Parameters:
contextContext to be set.
